dcterms:description: This dataset simulates illegal maritime drug trafficking on a 7884×3538 grid along the Central American Pacific Coastline. The adversary, a drug smuggler, is pursued by a team of heterogeneous tracker agents comprising airplanes and marine vessels. Airplanes have a larger search radius and speed than marine vessels, but only the vessels can capture the smuggler. Smugglers must first reach rendezvous points before heading to the hideouts, representing drug handoffs at sea.
dcterms:title: Narco Traffic Interdiction - Smuggler-Low

dcterms:title: Narco Traffic Interdiction - Smuggler-High

dcterms:description: This dataset is designed as a complex pursuit-evasion domain inspired by military surveillance problems, where a highly intelligent adversary is capable of adapting its behaviors to evade the tracking agents. The game is played on a 2428 × 2428 map with varying terrains where each cell on the grid represents the (x, y) location.
dcterms:title: Prison Escape - Prisoner-Low
